TourGuide
Hello blank fragment Kai Arizona’s only AAA Five-Diamond and Forbes Five-Star restaurant. features a menu rich in creativity, history and Native American culture. 5594 Wild Horse Pass Blvd, Phoenix, AZ 85048 $$$$ (602) 385–5726
Eddie Vs Prime Seafood and Steak restaurant at the Scottsdale Quarter. Happy hour, live jazz music,valet parking. 15323 N Scottsdale Rd, Scottsdale, AZ 88524 $$$ (480) 730–4800
Wrights Contemporary restaurant dishing out high-end New American fare inside the luxury Biltmore Hotel. 2400 E Missouri Ave, Phoenix, AZ 88016 $$$ (855) 689–2878
North\'s at Arcadia Contemporary takes on Italian classics star at this warehouse-chic trattoria with a lively bar. 4925 N 40th St, Phoenix, AZ 88018 $$$ (602) 324–5600
Firebird Grill Chain restaurant serving steaks, seafood and cocktails in an upscale lodgelike setting 3435 W Chandler Blvd", Chandler, AZ 85226 $$$ 480 730–4800
Carolina\s Landmark Mexican joint turning out traditional dishes in a basic, counter-serve setting. 1202 E Mohave St, Phoenix, AZ 85034 $$ (602) 252–1503
Kabuki Japanese chain with a clubby vibe offering sushi, entrees, lunch specials and happy hours. 2000 E Rio Salado Pkwy, Tempe, AZ 85281 $$ (480) 350–9160
The Pima Air and Space Museum One of the largest non-government funded aviation and space museums in the world! Featuring over 300 historical aircraft 6000 E. Valencia Rd, Tucson, AZ 85756> (520) 574–0462
Canyon DeChelley National Park For nearly 5,000 years, people have lived in these canyons - longer than anyone has lived uninterrupted anywhere on the Colorado Plateau Chinle, AZ 86503 (928) 674–5500
Grand Canyon Park National Park A natural formation distinguished by layered bands of red rock, revealing millions of years of geological history in cross-section Grand Canyon, AZ 86023> (928) 638–7888
Humphreys Peak Humphreys Peak is the highest natural point in the U.S. state of Arizona, with an elevation of 12,633 feet. Flaggstaff, AZ 35.34640°N / 111.6778°W None
Titan Missile Museum Air Force Facility Missile Site 8 also known as the Titan II ICBM Site 571-7, is a former ICBM missile 1580 Duval Mine Road, Green Valley, AZ 85614 (520) 625–7736
Diamondback\s Baseball The Arizona Diamondbacks are a professional baseball team were founded in 1998 as an expansion team in the National League\'s West Division of the MLB. They became the fastest expansion team to win a World Series title (four seasons) when they beat three-time defending champ the New York Yankees in 2001 Bank One Ballpark, 401 East Jefferson Street, Phoenix, AZ 85044 (602) 462–6500
Cardinals Football The Arizona Cardinals are a professional football team that was founded in 1898 1 Cardinals Dr, Glendale, AZ 85305 (623) 433–7101
Suns Basketball The Phoenix Suns play in the NBA\'s Pacific Division and are the only team not from California in that division. They were founded in 1968 and play their home games in Talking Stick Resort Arena. They have appeared in two NBA Finals, and lost both. 201 E Jefferson St, Phoenix, AZ 85004 (602) 379–7800
Coyotes Hockey The Arizona Coyotes are a professional hockey league team based in Glendale. They play their home games at Gila River Arena. The have never played in a Stanley Cup Final. They moved to Arizona in 1996 from Winnipeg, Manitoba. 9400 W Maryland Ave, Glendale, AZ 85305 (623) 249–2102
Mercury Womens Basketball The Phoenix Mercury are a professional women\'s basketball team based in Phoenix. They play their home games at Talking Stick Resort Arena. They were founded in 1997 as one of the league\'s inaugural teams. They play in the Pacific Division of the WNBA. They have won three WNBA titles. 201 E Jefferson St, Phoenix, AZ 85004 (602) 379–7800
Sanctuary Resort and Spa This famed Scottsdale luxury resort will introduce you to a refreshing new spirit of sophistication and relaxed refinements, as you discover 53 acres of your own private paradise 5700 East McDonald Drive Paradise Valley, AZ 85253 (480) 948–2100
L\'Auberge De Sedona Resort and Spa More than a hotel, a restaurant and a spa, L’Auberge is a place where extraordinary memories are created, romance rekindled and where unplugging results in true connection. 301 L\'Auberge Lane, Sedona, AZ 86336 (855) 905–5745
Fairmont Scottsdale Princess TThe AAA Five Diamond Fairmont Scottsdale Princess provides the perfect setting to enjoy al fresco living in the blooming Sonoran Desert 7575 East Princess Drive, Scottsdale, AZ 85255 (480) 585–4848
Hyatt Regency at Gainey Ranch Discover the infinite beauty and natural wonders of the Sonoran Desert surrounding our breathtaking 27-acre Scottsdale hotel in Arizona. Set amidst flowering cactus and framed against the majestic McDowell Mountains. 7500 E. Doubletree Ranch Road, Scottsdale, AZ 85258 (480) 444–1234
Four Seasons Resort Scottsdale at Troon Nestled into the foothills of Pinnacle Peak – amid towering, multi-armed saguaro cacti – the adobe casitas of Four Seasons Resort in Scottsdale, Arizona embody the desert’s magic through thoughtful design and the outstanding talent of regional artists and craftspeople. 10600 East Crescent Moon Drive, Scottsdale, AZ 85262 (480) 515–5700
